subtitleNullable: Frames from 800 top-rated movies for building movie identification models
descriptionNullable: Google's GEMINI can identify a movie if you show a few frames of it. Cool stuff! Can you build a model that can do the same thing? The dataset contains frames from approximately 800 top-rated movies. Each movie has around 1000 frames, totaling up to 800,000 frames in the dataset. > If you find this dataset valuable for building movie identification models, don't forget to hit the upvote button! 😊💝 Top rated movies were identified from my [TMDB Full movies](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/tmdb-movies-dataset-2023-930k-movies) dataset ### Checkout my top datasets - [Top Spotify Songs in 73 Countries](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/top-spotify-songs-in-73-countries-daily-updated) - [Wages by Education in the USA](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/wages-by-education-in-the-usa-1973-2022) - [Amazon Products Dataset (1.4M Products)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/amazon-products-dataset-2023-1-4m-products) - [TMDB 950K Movies](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/tmdb-movies-dataset-2023-930k-movies) - [Amazon Kindle Books (130K Books)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/amazon-kindle-books-dataset-2023-130k-books) ## Interesting Task Ideas: 1. Create a movie identification system that can predict the title of a movie based on extracted frames. 2. Train an AI model to identify similar scenes or genres using movie frames. 3. Develop a content-based recommendation system that suggests movies based on visual similarity. 4. Explore the correlation between movie ratings and the visual elements captured in the frames. Use [TMDB Full movies](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/asaniczka/tmdb-movies-dataset-2023-930k-movies) for ratings 5. Train deep learning models like VIT or ResNet using the dataset to develop powerful movie identification systems. ## Specs: - Each frame has a height of 256px. - Width will vary since different movies have different aspect ratios. - Roughly 1000 frames were extracted from each movie. - All frames for a movie will exist under the folder with the movie's name. - Movie names are in the format of `Movie name (Year of release)`. - To get more details on movies, use my TMDB movies dataset. Movie names are not a 100% match. Filter by release year and try semantic similarity or vector similarity. --- Photo by Jakob Owens on Unsplash
